abstract: Judge David T Bristow orders Enrique Marquez, who bought weapons that couple used in San Bernardino, Calif, massacre, be held without bail, saying he is threat to public; Marquez is charged with conspiring to support terrorists, stemming from 2011-2012 plots that he and Syed Rizwan Farook, who died in shootout with police during San Bernardino attack, planned.
lead_paragraph: Enrique Marquez, accused of abetting the couple who killed 14 people this month, said he had no questions about his case in a brief court appearance.

headline.main: Neighbor of San Bernardino Attackers Is Ordered Held Without Bail
headline.print_headline: Friend Who Bought Guns in San Bernardino Attack Is Deemed a Threat and Denied Bail

snippet: Enrique Marquez, accused of abetting the couple who killed 14 people this month, said he had no questions about his case in a brief court appearance.
